title: Classification of Crystal Systems on HAADF STEM Images using Fractal-Based Neural Network
content: Classification of crystal systems for scanning transmission electron microscopy (STEM) images has been attempted before but often on limited datasets with respect to the number of crystal systems being included or the zone axes being included in the dataset. In this work, we use a deep learning network to classify STEM images into all 7 crystal systems with sample materials oriented at random zone axes. The dataset used for this project is the Atomagined dataset [1-3] which consists of simulated HAADF STEM images. It contains 6,670 ICSD structure prototypes oriented at random zone axes to give us 67,869 distinct images. The dataset also contains images with simulated noise such as scanning noise, background noise, blur, etc.
